title: No plans to reintroduce Rs 1,000 notes, says Shaktikanta Das | india-news | Hindustan Times
text:
No plans to reintroduce Rs 1,000 notes, says Shaktikanta Das india Updated: Feb 22, 2017 12:22 IST Raj Kumar Ray New Delhi, Hindustan Times There was speculation that the Rs 1,000 note could make a comeback as consumers say they continue to face problems in transacting with the Rs 2,000 notes at the retail level.(Shankar Mourya/HT Photo) 
The government has no plans to reintroduce Rs 1,000 notes, economic affairs secretary Shaktikanta Das said on Wednesday, three months after a decision to scrap Rs 500 and Rs 1000 banknotes in India’s fight against black money, corruption and terror funding. 
The shock move led to a severe cash crunch. The government has said it will replenish most of the withdrawn cash – about 86% of the money in circulation -- with new 2000-and 500-rupee notes. 
Das tweeted: No plans to introduce ₹1000 notes. Focus is on production and supply of ₹500 and lower denomination notes. — Shaktikanta Das (@DasShaktikanta) February 22, 2017 
There was speculation that the Rs 1,000 note could make a comeback as consumers say they continue to face problems in transacting with the Rs 2,000 notes at the retail level. 
The Congress criticised the Narendra Modi-led government over opting for Rs 2,000 notes instead of Rs 1,000 to fight graft. Read more
